tweet_text:
@Yamiche I absolutely agree!  It’s inhumane, immoral, and unconscionable.  Relocate them in a SAFE place—
DO NOT return them to the country where they were unsheltered, starving, at the mercy of countless natural disaster—living in fear, without hope.
text_en: I absolutely agree! Its inhumane, immoral, and unconscionable. Relocate them in a SAFE place DO NOT return them to the country where they were unsheltered, starving, at the mercy of countless natural disasterliving in fear, without hope.

tweet_text: @CarolineKautsi1 I wouldn’t ask another writer to do it unless I were willing to pay them or repay them in kind. We have to set boundaries. The only people I would do it for without charging would be my closest family and friends. I might also do it for young writers who are new to writing.
text_en: I wouldnt ask another writer to do it unless I were willing to pay them or repay them in kind. We have to set boundaries. The only people I would do it for without charging would be my closest family and friends. I might also do it for young writers who are new to writing.

tweet_text:
@storebrandguy Fear of suffering is hard. The only way I know out completely today is the meditative path. A much harder road than simply removing fear of death, but I think it’s worth it

One day we’ll pave better roads
